On 10/18/05, Jeff Grigg <jeffgrigg@...> wrote:
>
> --- Robert Watki=
ns <yahoo@t...> wrote:
> > Well... in most GUI JUnit runners (like the ones=
 inside IDEs),
> > you can just click on the failing test and re-run it dir=
ectly.
> > This is possible because JUnit uses seperate instances per
> > t=
est (mild dig at Cedric) - as such, a moniker isn't strictly
> > necessary =
(though it wouldn't hurt).
>
> Oh?
>
> Most IDEs I've used start a new proc=
ess each time you ask them to run
> test(s). So in Eclipse (which I'm using=
 now), how does the TestCase
> instance in the first test process, which ha=
s terminated, get into a
> new test process that is now starting up?


That=
's another very good point.

TestNG's Eclipse plug-in uses a similar system=
 to JUnit's Eclipse plug-in
for this (fork a process and communicate with i=
t to gather the results).

--
C=E9dric
